args:
Tsukuyomi seeks to bring about a land of the
dead ruled by dragons, and coldly tells the
captive heroes how they'll be killed and reborn
as her mindless army. Things look dire indeed
until Fudo Myo-o frees the party and Shingen
encourages them to stand and fight back!

Hinomoto
An island far to the east, born of the ancestral
dragons Izanagi and Izanami and ruled over
by the twin pillars who inherited their might,
Amaterasu and Tsukuyomi.

But in time, their rule diverged. Amaterasu sought
to walk side by side with people, while Tsukuyomi
yearned for a world shaped by dragons. And so it
was Hinomoto came to know its first conflict,
the War of Earth and Heaven.

The long and bloody fight ended with Amaterasu's
victory. Tsukuyomi was sealed away inside a dark
and desolate cave, and Hinomoto blossomed
under human rule.
...Until a hundred years ago, when\nTsukuyomi vanished. Correct, Izumo?
Y-yes, sir, that's correct. But as for how\nexactly she made it from that cave\nto the Realm of the Dead...
Oh ho! Someone has an interest in tales\nof old, eh? Ah, but I have missed the mild\namusements of idle banter.
Well then. Long ago and longer still,\na man approached me in my prison.

He told of an outside world lost in the
chaos of war, and begged for the water of
immortality I create, hoping it might aid
his dying lord.
A beautiful tale of fealty, is it not?\nNaturally, I readily assented.
...On the condition he bring me\nan Underworld Key in return.
Which allowed you to escape into the\nRealm of the Dead?
Do not rush the telling, child! For even I\nam not able to pass into the underworld\nquite so easily.

The crossing requires both an Underworld
Key and a prodigious amount of chi—
the flow of which was blocked by the
cave that held me prisoner.
Seeing no other option, I ended my life,\nand used the chi from that act to fling\nwide the gates to the Realm of the Dead.
You offered up your own life as a\nsacrifice? That's madness!

No. Merely a stratagem too bold for most.
In death, my chi merged with that of the
Realm of the Dead, and the two took form
as one.
All that remained was to contact the living\nworld in secret and guide the Mukuroshu\nto open the Realm's gates for me.
All this was so I might return to Hinomoto\nagain on this night.
So you staged a jailbreak and wound up\nmore powerful than before? I don't think\nI like this lady at ALL.
Still your tongue, child, and bear in mind\nthat you speak now to she who will rule\nover your kind forevermore.
Then you mean to take your Mukuroshu\nsoldiers and march on the shogunate?
I do. Beginning tonight, this world which\nwas led astray by Amaterasu will be razed\nto its very foundations using my power.

Dragons will lie prostrate before me,
and all people shall be put to the sword.
With these acts, I will usher in a glorious
new kingdom of the dead!
You would kill your own subjects?!
Do you not see that for the blessing it is?\nNever again will you have cause to\ncower in fear as you do now.
Poor dear. You're trembling! Why not come\nand find peace everlasting at my feet—\nthe peace of being a lifeless puppet?
Hmph. What a twisted fantasy. As a fellow\ndragon, I'm honestly creeped out.
Bold words! But you will come to see the\nright of it once you witness my new world.
Hinomoto is the land of dragons.\nThe will of man has no place in its rule.
Its people need simply obey the will of\ntheir queen. It will be the end of war and\nconflict; a paradise of endless peace.
The more you talk, the creepier it gets...
If my words are insufficient to make you\nunderstand, then perhaps a demonstration\nis in order.
Now then...whose life shall we use?
J-just what do you intend to do?!
Precisely what I said I would: end your\nlives and make you my faithful puppets\nbefore sending you off to kill more.
You seem rather skilled in magic, no?\nYou'll make a fine hunter of the living.\nOh ho ho ho!
Pffft! Bwaaaa ha ha ha ha!
What small thoughts you have, Tsukuyomi.

This would-be kingdom you speak of is
meaningless. A land's people are its
castles and walls, and there can be no
rule without them.
Just what is it you would claim to rule\nin a land of nothing but dragons and\ndead men?
Is a kingdom of the dead even a kingdom\nat all?
Oh ho ho! Do you hope to provoke me, sir?\nTo save your allies with coarse distraction?\nIt is a beautiful thought...but meaningless.
For you will die here all the same.
Still, since you seem to be clamoring to\nslip away from the fear of death, I am\nhappy to make you my first loyal subject.
Oh ho! Such spirit, this one! Adorable!\nThen come, you brave little man—be the\nfirst to tread the path to the beyond.
Ah, Fudo Myo-o. Perfect timing.\nI see you remain as thoughtful as ever.
I missed you so in our brief time apart,\nLord Shingen, and will have you free\nof your bonds presently.
So your little speech was a bid to\nbuy time, eh? Clever.
You must be Tsukuyomi. I will not forgive\nyou for attempting to harm Lord Shingen.
Is everyone untied? Good. The arms they\ntook from us are there, so seize them now!
Now that we know what Tsukuyomi is\nplotting, we have to stop her here!
Leave it to me! I don't care if it's a dragon\nor a soldier or what—I just REEEEALLY\nwanna punch something right now!
You? Defeat me? Oh ho ho ho!\nWhat laughable lunacy!
I had hoped for a set of pristine puppets...\nbut I suppose I'll just have to settle for\ndamaged goods instead.
Now, all of you...accept death's embrace!
